gw.api.database.upgrade.before

Class IBeforeUpgradeInsertBuilder

  • gw.api.database.upgrade.before.IBeforeUpgradeInsertBuilder

  • public class IBeforeUpgradeInsertBuilder
    Inserts some values in the given table

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Set<String> MappedTargetColumns
      Returns an unmodifiable Set of the target columns that have already been mapped.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int execute()
      Executes the query. If already in a transaction, the query executes in that transaction; otherwise a new transaction is created and committed when the method returns, or rolled back if the method throws an exception. The statement that is constructed will perform default behavior for the following columns (if present and not mapped):- ID: using a new key from the KeyGenerator PublicID: default public id prefix followed by a ':' followed by the numeric ID BeanVersion: 0 CreateTime: current time CreateUser: the current user UpdateTime: current time UpdateUser: the current user Retired: 0
      IBeforeUpgradeInsertBuilder mapColumn(String column, Object value)
      In the Insert statement, maps the given column to the given value
      IBeforeUpgradeInsertBuilder mapColumn(IBeforeUpgradeColumn column, Object value)
      In the Insert statement, maps the given column to the given value
      IBeforeUpgradeInsertBuilder withDescription(String descriptionForTheQuery)
      Sets a string describing the query. Useful for debugging performance issues.
      IBeforeUpgradeInsertBuilder withInsertHint(boolean withInsertHint)
      Whether to append hint in the generated SQL
      IBeforeUpgradeInsertBuilder withLogSQL(boolean logSQL)
      Turns on or off SQL logging. The query is logged to the PLLoggerCategory.SERVER_DATABASE log category at the info level
      IBeforeUpgradeInsertBuilder withSkipDefaultBehavior(boolean skip)
      This operation is able to set defaults for some well known fields, such as BeanVersion. However, before upgrade, this involves checking whether the column exists (we don't have metadata information). In some cases, this behavior is not desirable because of the cost to ping the database, e.g. in tests. Use true here if you have mapped all the desired fields and don't require the default behavior.

    • Field Detail

        Returns an unmodifiable Set of the target columns that have already been mapped.

      • execute

        int execute()
        Executes the query. If already in a transaction, the query executes in that transaction; otherwise a new transaction is created and committed when the method returns, or rolled back if the method throws an exception. The statement that is constructed will perform default behavior for the following columns (if present and not mapped):- ID: using a new key from the KeyGenerator PublicID: default public id prefix followed by a ':' followed by the numeric ID BeanVersion: 0 CreateTime: current time CreateUser: the current user UpdateTime: current time UpdateUser: the current user Retired: 0
        Returns:
        the number of rows affected

      • withSkipDefaultBehavior

        IBeforeUpgradeInsertBuilder withSkipDefaultBehavior(boolean skip)
        This operation is able to set defaults for some well known fields, such as BeanVersion. However, before upgrade, this involves checking whether the column exists (we don't have metadata information). In some cases, this behavior is not desirable because of the cost to ping the database, e.g. in tests. Use true here if you have mapped all the desired fields and don't require the default behavior.
        Parameters:
        skip - true to skip automated behavior
        Returns:
        this
